    • Method Detail

      • getDatabase

        public com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore getDatabase()
        Returns the database instance.
        Returns:
        Database object

      • close

        public boolean close()
        Closes the connection to the database.
        Returns:
        True if connection closed

      • createUser

        public User createUser(java.lang.String uname,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       boolean admin,
                       boolean active,
                       java.lang.String fname,
                       java.lang.String lname)
        Creates a user record with given attributes. Password is saved in the database using bcrypt algorithm with random salt. Password attribute becomes the hashed version in returned User object.
        Parameters:
        uname - Username
        password - plaintext password
        admin - Is user an admin?
        active - Is account active?
        fname - First name
        lname - Last name
        Returns:
        User object from given data

      • checkHashedPassword

        public boolean checkHashedPassword(java.lang.String plain,
                                   java.lang.String hashed)
        Checks plaintext password against the hashed version from the database to see if they match.
        Parameters:
        plain - Plaintext password
        hashed - Hashed password with salt
        Returns:
        True if plaintext becomes the hashed version when run through the hashing algorithm

      • updateUser

        public boolean updateUser(User u)
        Updates a user record with all values in u except for password. Use function updatePassword() to update the password.
        Parameters:
        u - User object to update

      • updatePassword

        public boolean updatePassword(User u)
        Updates the plaintext password saved in u, encrypts it, and saves the hashed password to the database.
        Parameters:
        u - Object with plaintext password
        Returns:
        True if successful

      • getUser

        public User getUser(java.lang.String uname)
        Retrieve user with given username.
        Parameters:
        uname - Username of user
        Returns:
        User object from database. Null if not found.

      • getDistributionsByDate

        public Distribution[] getDistributionsByDate(int month,
                                             int year)
        Returns all distributions in month and year of given variables. Month uses 0-11 for Jan-Dec. Will return an array with no elements if no records are found.
        Parameters:
        month - Month of records needed
        year - Year of records needed
        Returns:
        Array of Distribution objects in month, may be empty

      • getDistItemCountByDate

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Item>[] getDistItemCountByDate(int month,
                                                                         int year)
        Returns an array of hashmaps that hold the item ID and quantity sold in given month and year. Quantities are stored in each item's attribute, quantity.
        Parameters:
        month - Month 0-11 for JAN-DEC
        year - Year to search
        Returns:
        Array containing two hashmaps. [0] for SellableItem, [1] for NonSellableItem

      • createLocation

        public Location createLocation(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a location in the database.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of location
        Returns:
        Location object

      • getLocation

        public Location getLocation(java.lang.String id)
        Returns a locatino from the database.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of location
        Returns:
        Null if read failed

      • updateLocation

        public boolean updateLocation(Location loc)
        Update location with given object data.
        Parameters:
        loc - Location to update
        Returns:
        True if successful

      • getAllLocations

        public Location[] getAllLocations()
        Returns an array of all locations in the database. Will never return null. If no locations are found, it returns an array of zero length.
        Returns:
        Array of locations

      • createCategory

        public Category createCategory(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a category record in the database.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of category
        Returns:
        Category object with given data

        Updates category with attributes in c.
        Parameters:
        c - Category to update

      • getCategory

        public Category getCategory(java.lang.String id)
        Returns category with given ID.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of category
        Returns:
        Null if failed to read

      • getAllCategories

        public Category[] getAllCategories()
        Returns an array of all categories in the database.
        Returns:
        Array of categories or empty array if no categories exist

      • createSellableItem

        public boolean createSellableItem(java.util.Date rec,
                                  java.lang.String desc,
                                  Condition cond,
                                  double price,
                                  Category cat,
                                  int quantity,
                                  Location loc)
        Creates a sellable item in the database. ID of the item is generated.
        Parameters:
        rec - Date received
        desc - Additional description
        cond - Condition of item
        price - Price of item
        cat - Category of item
        quantity - Quantity in stock
        loc - Location of item
        Returns:
        True if successful

      • createNonSellableItem

        public boolean createNonSellableItem(java.util.Date rec,
                                     java.lang.String desc,
                                     Condition cond,
                                     double price,
                                     Category cat,
                                     java.lang.String source,
                                     int quantity,
                                     Location loc)
        Creates a nonsellable item in the database. ID is generated for item.
        Parameters:
        rec - Date received
        desc - Additional description
        cond - Condition of item
        price - Price of item
        cat - Category of item
        source - Source person/business of item
        quantity - Quantity of item
        loc - Location of item
        Returns:
        True if successful

      • getNonSellableItem

        public NonSellableItem getNonSellableItem(java.lang.String id)
        Returns a nonsellable object from the database with the given ID.
        Parameters:
        id - Barcode of item
        Returns:
        Null if read failed

      • getSellableItem

        public SellableItem getSellableItem(java.lang.String id)
        Returns a sellable object from the database with the given ID.
        Parameters:
        id - Barcode of item
        Returns:
        Null if read failed

      • getAllSellable

        public SellableItem[] getAllSellable()
        Retrieves all of the sellable items from the database.
        Returns:
        Array of sellable items or null

      • getAllNonSellable

        public NonSellableItem[] getAllNonSellable()
        Retrieves all of the sellable items from the database.
        Returns:
        Array of sellable items or null

      • updateItemQuantity

        public boolean updateItemQuantity(SellableItem item)
        Updates the quantity of the passed sellable item to the database. Use this function instead of updateItem() to save database read and writes.
        Parameters:
        item - Item to update
        Returns:
        True if successful

      • updateItemQuantity

        public boolean updateItemQuantity(NonSellableItem item)
        Updates the quantity of the passed sellable item to the database. Use this function instead of updateItem() to save database read and writes.
        Parameters:
        item - Item to update
        Returns:
        True if successful

      • updateSellable

        public boolean updateSellable(SellableItem item)
        Updates the sellable document with ID in item.
        Parameters:
        item - Item to update
        Returns:
        True if successful

      • updateNonSellable

        public boolean updateNonSellable(NonSellableItem item)
        Updates the nonsellable document with ID in item.
        Parameters:
        item - Item to update
        Returns:
        True is successful

      • createDistItemRelation

        public boolean createDistItemRelation(SellableItem[] sell,
                                      int[] sellQuant,
                                      NonSellableItem[] nonSell,
                                      int[] nonSellQuant,
                                      double amount,
                                      java.util.Date date,
                                      User user)
        Create a distribution of sellable items in the database. item and quantity are arrays of items and the number of each item sold and should be ordered with matching indices.
        Parameters:
        sell - Array of items in distribution
        sellQuant - Array of quantities of each item sold
        nonSell - Array of items in distribution
        nonSellQuant - Array of quantities of each item sold
        amount - Total + tax of sale
        date - Date of sale
        user - User who performed sale
        Returns:
        True if successful

      • getKit

        public Kit getKit(java.lang.String id)
        Returns the kit with the given barcode ID. Will return null if no kit is found.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of kit
        Returns:
        Kit object or null

      • getItemsFromKit

        public Item[] getItemsFromKit(Kit kit)
        Returns the items in a given kit. No items in kit will return an empty array.
        Parameters:
        kit - Kit to search
        Returns:
        Array of items in kit

      • saveKit

        public boolean saveKit(Kit kit,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String desc,
                       Item[] items,
                       boolean[] sellable,
                       int[] quantity)
        Saves a kit and its associated items. If the kit does not exist, a new one will be created. Then, The item relations with quantities are updated or created.
        Parameters:
        kit - Kit to use - Null for new kit
        name - Name of kit
        desc - Description of kit
        items - List of items to put in kit
        sellable - List of item sellable types. i.e. True for SellableItem type.
        quantity - List of quantities
        Returns:
        Returns true if the function is executed, not if the saves were successful.

      • deleteAllKitItemRelation

        public boolean deleteAllKitItemRelation(java.lang.String kitID)
        Deletes all kit/item relations from the database.
        Parameters:
        kitID - ID for the kit
        Returns:
        True if all deletes succeeded

      • getAllKits

        public Kit[] getAllKits()
        Returns an array of all the kits in the database. Will never be null. If no kits exist, function will return a zero length array.
        Returns:
        Array of Kit
